description.narrative: Increased knowledge, capacity and commitment of selected businesses with high impact on children to integrate child rights into operations and policies,which contributes to Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, concrete actions are taken by civil society, the corporate sector and the public for social changes that address critical child rights concerns

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased knowledge, capacity and commitment of selected businesses with high impact on children to integrate child rights into operations and policies

description.narrative: 2019 witnessed the formulation of major public-private sector partnerships and action with a focus on child labour prevention, young worker protection and decent work. Long-term collaboration frameworks with the Viet Nam Chambers of Commerce and Industry and the Human Rights Institute of Viet Nam's Ho Chi Minh National Political Academy were formalized in 2019. Key results were VCCI's recognition of child rights as a criterion for sustainable business in the country and the launch of a practical guide on General Comment 16 of the Committee on the Rights of the Child. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
